intro: Gymnosphaera rubella, commonly known as the red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Gymnosphaera rubella is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping in drought-prone regions.
